description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Bhubaneswar's Heart" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Bhubaneswar's Heart

places.generalDescription: Nandankanan Zoological Park, located in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, is a sprawling 437-hectare zoo and botanical garden established in 1960. It's home to over 1,500 animals including white tigers and pangolins. The park offers various attractions such as boating, safaris featuring white tigers, lions, bears and herbivores, a reptile park, zoo museum, orchid house and an aquarium.

sources.snippet: Credits: Dreamodisha, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. It is one of the very first zoos opened in India. There are a total of 3004 species, including mammals, birds, reptiles and amphibians at Nandankanan Zoological Park.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: For animal lovers, Nandankanan Zoological Park offers an exciting day out. This zoo and botanical garden is home to a variety of wildlife, including the rare white tiger. As you explore the park, you can enjoy the beautiful landscapes and serene lakes.
sources.siteName: Guide Tour Explore Tourist places India
sources.shortName: 16 Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: For adventurous couples, Nandankanan Zoological Park offers a unique experience. Explore the animal kingdom together, sharing moments of awe and wonder. The joy of discovering wildlife in each other‚Äôs company adds a special charm to the outing.

sources.snippet: Nandankanan Zoological Park is one of the best places to visit in Bhubaneswar for couples. It is a botanical garden and zoo situated within the Kanjia Lake, Bhubaneswar. It is also the largest and biggest zoological parks in India.

The most loved tourist places to explore in Bhubaneswar are Nandankanan Zoological Park, Lingaraj Temple and Odisha State Museum. You will have an amazing time exploring these places and come back home with a bag full of memories.

sources.snippet: Wildlife Adventure: Nandankanan, aptly named 'The Garden of Heaven', offers a rich array of wildlife in a serene forest setting, adjacent to the Chandaka-Dampara Wildlife Sanctuary.

places.name: Nandankanan Zoological Park

reviews.text:
My recent zoo visit was both enjoyable and educational. The variety of animals was impressive, including lions, giraffes, and playful monkeys. The enclosures were clean and well-maintained, offering good views without disturbing the animals. Informative signs taught me interesting facts about each species. The staff was friendly and eager to answer questions. Overall, it was a delightful experience, perfect for families and anyone interested in wildlife.
Adventure activity like boatingüö§,zip liningüöà,Toy trainüöÜare also available.

Nandankanan is a top recommendation for anyone who loves wildlife and nature. It's not just a great spot for families, but also a standout zoo in India due to its strong focus on conservation and its beautiful natural setting. While a few small tweaks to maintenance and crowd management could make the experience even better, its unique qualities make it a must-see destination.
* Timings: The park is open from 7:30 AM to 5:30 PM from April to September and from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM from October to March. Please note, it is closed on Mondays.

Just visited Nandankanan Zoological Park recently, and honestly, I had a really good time here. The zoo is pretty big and well maintained. Loved the greenery all around ‚Äì it gives such a calm and refreshing vibe üåø

Got to see so many animals up close, especially the white tiger, which was amazing! üêØ The safari was also a great experience ‚Äì felt exciting to see animals roaming freely in that area. Definitely something different from the usual zoo experience.

It's a great spot to spend time with family or friends. There's boating too if you're into that kind of chill vibe üö£‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Overall, I'd totally recommend this place if you're in or around Bhubaneswar. Worth the visit üëç

places.generalDescription: Lingaraj Temple, situated in Bhubaneswar, is a renowned Hindu temple devoted to Lord Shiva. It holds great historical and cultural significance and is known for its distinctive Kalinga-style architecture. The temple complex features intricately carved stone towers, courtyards, and numerous shrines. According to ancient inscriptions and Sanskrit treatises, the temple is at the center of a sacred area surrounded by other significant temples and mango groves.

sources.snippet: Start your romantic journey at Lingaraj Temple, an architectural marvel dedicated to Lord Shiva. This temple, built in the 11th century, stands as one of the most significant religious sites in Bhubaneswar. As you approach the temple, notice the towering spire and intricate carvings that adorn the walls.
sources.siteName: Guide Tour Explore Tourist places India

sources.snippet: Lingaraja Temple is one of the wonderful tourist places in Bhubaneswar and the oldest Hindu temple devoted to Lord Shiva and one of those eminent tourist sites in the city. This temple represents the concord between two different sects of Hinduism, Shaivism and Vaishnavism.

places.name: Lingaraj Temple

reviews.text: Visiting the temple was truly a remarkable experience, filled with a sense of peace and spirituality. The intricate architecture and the detailed carvings are absolutely breathtaking, showcasing exquisite craftsmanship. It was fascinating to witness the rituals and ceremonies performed with such devotion and precision. The atmosphere surrounding the temple creates a feeling of serenity, allowing for moments of introspection. Overall, a visit to this temple is a must for anyone seeking a glimpse into the rich cultural heritage.

What can I say about Lingaraj Temple, it has such a good history. You can google it anywhere. You will find its history at every place. When was it built, how was it built, where was it built?
But I will tell you about the management here. I liked the management here. Now see, the thing is that when you go to keep your shoes or phone here, they will ask you for money and A don't know they charge ‚Çπ20 for keeping the phone. They also charge ‚Çπ20 for shoes.. I don't know why they do this, I feel that this should be a free service and we should give as much as we wish.

After going inside this temple, you will see Lord Shiva. Here inside this temple, you will find many gods. If you want, you can also see them there.

It is one of the oldest and most revered temples in Odisha. This temple is dedicated to not one but two primary deities, Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu. Thus, symbolizing the coming together of Shaivism and Vaishnavism, two prominent sects of Hinduism.

I visited in weekends so it was rush mobile phone not allowed inside temple but there is entrance gate you can submit your electronic devices and shoes wallet allowed temple is beautiful amazing it's take time to explore you will love it the beautiful architecture it's beautiful experience

places.generalDescription: Nestled atop the serene Dhauli Hills in Odisha, the Dhauli Shanti Stupa, also known as the Peace Pagoda, is a stunning white structure that radiates tranquility. Constructed in 1972 through a collaboration between Japanese and Indian Buddhist organizations, this remarkable shrine serves as a poignant reminder of Emperor Ashoka's transformation from a conqueror to an advocate for peace following the Kalinga War.

sources.snippet: Dhauli Shanti Stupa in Odisha stands as a symbol of peace and tranquility, perched atop Dhauli Hills overlooking the Daya River. This majestic white stupa, built in the early 1970s, commemorates the historic Kalinga War and Emperor Ashoka's transformative journey from conquest to Buddhism, promoting a message of non-violence and harmony.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

sources.snippet: Credits: Sailesh Patnaik, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. Also known as Peace Pagoda, Shanti Stupa of Dhauligiri marks the end of the great Kalinga War. When King Ashoka adopted the path of peace and took up Buddhism, he laid the foundation of the Dhauli Shanti Stupa.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: The Shanti Stupa is also called Peace Pagoda and was built by the Japan Buddha Sangh and the Kalinga Nippon Buddha Sangh in the 70s. It is situated at the top of the Dhauli Giri hill about 7 kilometres away from Bhubaneswar (on the way to Puri). Many tourists and locals frequent this place to meditate and pray.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Iconic Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Dhauli Shanti Stupa stands as a symbol of peace and harmony. Couples can bask in the tranquil ambiance, enjoying panoramic views of the city and the soothing breeze. The scenic beauty amplifies the romantic aura, making it an ideal spot for couples to spend quality time together.

places.generalDescription: The Shree Mukteswara Temple in Bhubaneswar is a remarkable 10th-century Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is celebrated for its stunning Kalinga architecture, intricate artwork, and ornate carvings depicting various Hindu deities. The temple's architectural features include a beautifully arched entrance and exquisite stone sculptures adorning the walls.

sources.snippet: A short drive away, you‚Äôll find Mukteshwar Temple, often referred to as the ‚Äúgem of Odisha.‚Äù This temple showcases stunning architecture and intricate stone carvings, making it a must-visit for couples. As you explore the temple grounds, you can appreciate the beautiful gardens that surround the structure. Take a moment to relax in the gardens, which provide a tranquil space to enjoy each other‚Äôs company.

places.name: Mukteswara Temple

reviews.text: The Mukteswara Temple, located in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, is a 10th-century temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is considered a masterpiece of Kalinga-style architecture, often called the "Gem of Odisha architecture." The temple is renowned for its ornate torana (arched gateway), intricate carvings of celestial beings, and detailed sculptural work. The Shiva Lingam inside is a revered pilgrimage site. The temple also showcases early influences of Buddhist and Jain architecture. Situated in the Old Town near major temples like Lingaraj, it is easily accessible by taxis, auto-rickshaws, and local buses, making it a must-visit heritage site.

The Mukteswar Temple in Bhubaneswar is a stunning example of early Kalinga architecture and is often regarded as the ‚ÄúGem of Odisha architecture.‚Äù Built in the 10th century, this small yet intricately designed temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is renowned for its beautifully carved arched gateway (torana), exquisite sculptures, and detailed motifs depicting scenes from mythology and everyday life. The temple's elegant design, harmonious proportions, and fine craftsmanship make it a must-visit for lovers of art, history, and architecture. Surrounded by a peaceful ambiance, it offers a serene spiritual experience, right in the heart of the city.
The temple is historical and the garden is well maintained. The shoes are kept outside the Temple Gate and then you can see the temple and the idols kept inside it.

places.address: 6RVR+35P, Old Town, Kedar Gouri Vihar, Old Town, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751019, India

places.generalDescription: The Odisha State Museum, established in 1932, originated from a collection of archaeological treasures by historians. Initially focused on archaeology, it now houses over 55,000 exhibits spanning various sections including archaeology, natural history, art and craft. The museum showcases sculptures, terracotta, numismatics, copper plates and fine arts. Visitors can explore musical instruments, rare palm leaf manuscripts, coins and Orissan tribal artifacts among other historical relics.

sources.snippet: For those interested in history, the Odisha State Museum offers a fascinating glimpse into the region‚Äôs rich heritage. The museum houses a collection of artifacts, sculptures, and paintings that showcase Odisha‚Äôs art and culture. Wandering through the exhibits can spark interesting conversations between couples, allowing you to learn more about each other while discovering the history of the region.
sources.siteName: Guide Tour Explore Tourist places India
sources.shortName: 16 Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Credits: Steve Browne & John Verkleir, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. If you want to get deep insights into the history of Odisha and the country itself, you should head to the Odisha State Museum. You will be mesmerised to see the rare and antique collection of artefacts, stone sculptures, numismatics, antiquities, bronze, copper items, etc.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: Being a famous museum in the town Bhubaneswar, Odisha State Museum is highly visited by couples as it offers a different experience. The museum is categorized into 11 sections. The museum houses a huge collection of Jain and Buddhist sculptures, copper plates, coins, manuscripts, medieval and ancient tools and weapons, geological objects, paintings and much more.

Located in the education centre of BJB Nagar, the museum initially displayed a modest collection that included ancient coins, excavated sculptures etc. But over a period of time, it evolved and now houses a vast range of rare artefacts, archaeological specimens, preserved art collections and age-old manuscripts.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Bhubaneshwar in 2024

sources.snippet: The Odisha State Museum houses artifacts, texts, images, and much more. All of these are synonymous with Odisha‚Äôs rich history. Some of the important artifacts stored are bronze tools, paintings, and a unique collection of rare palm-leaf manuscripts.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Iconic Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Bhubaneswar tour places itinerary might be brimming, but ensure you don‚Äôt miss the State Museum‚Äòs remarkable displays. From prehistoric artifacts to palm leaf manuscripts, this repository of Odia culture is educational as well as entertaining.

places.name: Odisha State Museum

reviews.text: My friend and I went to the Odisha State Museum, and we both enjoyed a lot there. It is located in the Kalpana Chowk infront of Utkal Kanika Galleria. There are numismatics, epigraphy, manuscripts, armoury, library, arts and crafts, mining and geology, natural history and anthropology, also there is The Kalinga Art Gallery, where you can look at the masterpieces of the artists all over the Odisha. The Odisha State Museum holds a lot of collections including The Kalinga Art Gallery over a two storey building in Kalpana Chowk, Bhubaneswar. I got to learn a lot about the rich culture of our Odisha. The ticket prices for each adult and child below 10 years are ‚Çπ20 and ‚Çπ10 respectively. Also you have to pay ‚Çπ10 extra for photography. Everyone must visit this place once in their life time including school children, because they ll get to know many more new things and rich heritage and culture about our state Odisha.

I went to the Odisha State Museum last month, and it was pretty cool.
I loved checking out all the art, artifacts, and cultural stuff there.
You could easily spend a couple of hours, or even more, just looking at all the art that shows off Indian and Odisha's culture.
Plus, the museum is clean and well-kept.
The ticket price is totally worth it. I'd definitely recommend it for school trips and tourists in Odisha.

I visited this place few years back.. but now they have added many new galleries and the collection is very attractive and unique. Kids will learn a lot. As a antique lover I enjoyed each and every gallery. A must visit place.

places.address: State Museum, Kalpana Square, BJB Nagar, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751014, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled just 6 kilometers from the vibrant city of Bhubaneshwar, the Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves are a treasure trove of ancient history, dating back to the 1st century BCE. These intricately carved cave dwellings served as homes for Jain ascetics and offer a unique glimpse into their simple yet profound lifestyle.

sources.snippet: Lingaraja Temple: Start your exploration of Bhubaneswar's historical and cultural attractions with a visit to the magnificent Lingaraja Temple. This ancient temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, is a masterpiece of Kalinga architecture. Marvel at its towering spire, intricately carved sculptures, and sacred rituals that take place within its premises.
sources.shortName: Best Place for Couples in Bhubaneswar! - Blogs

sources.snippet: Situated a few miles away from Bhubaneswar, the Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves are rock cut caves believed to have been carved out by Jain monks. The caves sit adjacent to each other and have inscriptions written all over its walls. Within the two caves, there are many small caves that have important stone carvings, footprints, and sculptures.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Iconic Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: For a quick getaway, discover the bhubaneswar nearby places offering a blend of wildlife, pilgrimage, and natural beauty. The Nandankanan Zoological Park captivates with its rare white tigers and enthralling safaris. A day trip to the sun-kissed beaches of Puri or the tranquil waters of Chilika Lake will rejuvenate your senses.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Attractions in Bhubaneswar for Couples!

sources.snippet: Next, head to the Khandagiri and Udayagiri Caves, a set of ancient rock-cut caves that offer a glimpse into the region‚Äôs history. These caves date back to the 2nd century BCE and were once inhabited by Jain monks. As you explore the caves, you can admire the fascinating carvings and inscriptions.
sources.siteName: Guide Tour Explore Tourist places India
sources.shortName: 16 Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Khandagiri caves are popularly and locally known as the Cuttack Caves. The artificial cave is popular with couples because they can silently sneak into the caves and have their romantic time together. The beautiful cave surrounds itself with greeneries and nature making it perfect romance locus.

The Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves are archaeologically, historically, and religiously significant caves which are one of the eminent tourist sites in the city of Odisha. The majority of these caves are thought to have been used by Jain monks as living places during King Kharavela's rule.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025

sources.snippet: Khandagiri and Udayagiri Caves offer a surreal setting for couples who appreciate history and art. Exploring the ancient caves, hand in hand, and marveling at the intricate carvings can evoke a sense of shared wonder, weaving romantic moments into the tapestry of time.
sources.shortName: BEST PLACES TO VISIT IN BHUBANESWAR FOR COUPLES | GUIDE | by ontravelx

sources.snippet: Credits: Phadke09, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. One of the twin caves of Bhubaneswar is the Udayagiri Caves. With 18 existing caves, it stands tall with historically significant ancient sculptures and reliefs.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

places.name: Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves

reviews.text: Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves are really amazing to visit. These ancient caves are beautifully carved and have a lot of history connected to Jain monks. The stone carvings are worth seeing, and some caves also give you a glimpse of meditation cells used in old times. The view from the top is also nice and peaceful. Best time to visit is in the evening or early morning when it's not too hot.

Situated on the outskirts of a bustling city in Odisha, this ancient site is a remarkable blend of history, spirituality, and nature. Carved into solid rock, the twin hill structures hold centuries-old caves that once served as dwellings and meditation chambers for monks. These rock-cut marvels are not just architectural wonders but also sacred spaces that echo the deep roots of Jainism and its teachings in the region.

The caves are adorned with intricate carvings, inscriptions, and symbolic motifs that reflect the simplicity and discipline of monastic life. Each chamber tells a silent tale of devotion, enlightenment, and the human quest for inner peace. The cool interiors, despite the surrounding heat, offer a calming and reflective environment, inviting visitors to pause and connect with a timeless past.

The surrounding landscape adds to the charm - lush greenery, chirping birds, and panoramic views of the city from the hilltops create a perfect blend of history and natural beauty. Climbing the stone steps to explore each cave is like walking through the pages of a living history book. The serenity of the place makes it a favorite for spiritual seekers, historians, and nature lovers alike.

What truly sets this site apart is its silent endurance through the ages. It continues to inspire with its blend of art, faith, and resilience. Whether it's a quiet sunrise visit or a thoughtful exploration of the caves, the experience leaves one with a deep appreciation for Odisha's ancient legacy and the peaceful strength of its spiritual traditions.

The Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves, carved in the 1st century BCE by King Kharavela of the Mahameghavahana dynasty, served as residential and meditative retreats for Jain monks and feature the famous Hathigumpha inscription detailing the king's reign.

These caves are of immense historical and religious importance, showcasing early Jain art, rock-cut architecture, and the cultural richness of ancient Kalinga.

Today, they are preserved as heritage monuments and attract pilgrims, historians, and tourists as a symbol of Odisha's spiritual and archaeological legacy.

places.address: 7Q7M+2V7, Khandagiri, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751030, India

places.generalDescription: The Regional Museum of Natural History is a museum dedicated to the conservation and display of natural history specimens from across the region. The collection encompasses both scientific collections and artefacts representative of local cultures and traditions. The museum is open to the public on weekdays from 9am to 5pm, and admission is free. Highlights of the collection include exhibits on geology, botany, zoology, archaeology and ethnography.

sources.snippet: Regional Museum of Natural History has an impressive collection of plants, skeletons of rare and extinct animals, photographs and relevant samples from all over the world and information on the geology of the city. Established by the Ministry of Environment and Forest, this is the only museum in India that has, on display, a rare egg of the now extinct Elephant Bird, the Baleen Whale and many more (Read More) such exhibits that help enlighten the knowledge of animal and nature lovers.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

sources.snippet: Though it is not the place for romance, there‚Äôs no harm in learning together. The museum is great for the collection of natural history that comprises of photographs, skeletons of extinct and rare animals, plants, and other pertinentsamples from worldwide. Enthusiast‚Äôs lovers find this museum a great and interesting place.Timings: 10.00 AM to 6.00 PMEntry Fee: No entry feeWebsite: http://www.nmnh.nic.in/Bhubaneswar.htm

Credits: Ramjit Tudu, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. We don‚Äôt want you to miss out on this museum since it exhibits the rich botany, zoology, and geology of Odisha. The Regional Museum of Natural History aims to create environmental awareness for visiting students by having experiential resource centres such as the ‚ÄòDiscovery Room‚Äô, ‚ÄòActivity Room‚Äô, etc.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

places.name: Regional Museum of Natural History

reviews.text:
Visiting the Regional Museum of Natural History, Bhubaneswar was a great experience! The museum is well-organized and has amazing displays about nature, wildlife, and tribal life. One of the best parts is the life-size animal models, which make you feel like you're in a real jungle.

The museum has sections on different animals, birds, marine life, and even fossils. Seeing dinosaur fossils up close was really exciting! The tribal section teaches about how local communities live in harmony with nature. Everything is presented in a simple and interesting way, so both kids and adults can enjoy it.

What I loved the most was how interactive and educational the museum is. There are plenty of things to learn, and it's a great place for school trips and families. Plus, the best part-it's completely free! The museum is well-maintained, and the staff is friendly.

If you are in Bhubaneswar and love nature or wildlife, this place is a must-visit. It's a peaceful and informative place where you can spend a couple of hours exploring and learning. Highly recommended for nature lovers, students, and anyone curious about the world around us!

I really enjoyed my visit to the Regional Museum of Natural History. The exhibits are not only informative but also beautifully arranged. I was especially impressed by the fossil section and the life-size animal models - they truly bring nature to life. It's a peaceful and inspiring place, perfect for a weekend visit with family or friends. Highly recommended.
Absolute delight to tour this museum. There are so many things for a curious mind in this museum. Definitely a must visit place if you are planning a vacation in Bhubaneswar

places.address: Sachivalaya Marg, near Planetorium, Doordarshan Colony, Acharya Vihar, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751013, India

places.generalDescription: The Brahmeswara Temple, constructed in the 9th century under King Udyotakesari of the Somvasi dynasty, is a renowned Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Its elegant Kalinga-style architecture and ornate carvings make it a popular attraction for tourists and historians. The temple complex consists of a main shrine surrounded by four similar shrines, with doorways adorned with intricately carved figures and depictions of the nine planets in Indian astrology.

sources.snippet: Credits: Ssriram mt, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. Built-in the traditional Kalinga style of architecture, Brameswara Temple is known for its artistic sculptures. You can spot the carvings of birds, animals, and deities on the temple's exterior walls.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: Lastly, must visit places in Bhubaneswar include the Parasurameswara Temple, the Brahmeswara Temple, and the Mukteswara Temple. These ancient structures are a testament to the Kalinga style of architecture and are invaluable for anyone interested in India‚Äôs historical and religious landscape.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Attractions in Bhubaneswar for Couples!

places.name: Brahmeswara Temple

reviews.text: This is one if the most elaboratedly done temple in Bhubaneshwara. It has one main Shiva temple and four other small temples around it. The main temple has very breathtakingly beautiful carvings, which are mostly in good condition. As its a bit far from city center, many tourist do not come here, but you should not miss it.

The Brahmeswar Temple in Bhubaneswar is a masterpiece of Kalinga architecture, standing as a testament to Odisha's rich heritage. Built in 1058 CE by Kolavati Devi, the mother of Somavamsi king Udyotakesari, this temple marks an important transition in temple design, showcasing intricate craftsmanship and artistic excellence.

Carved out of sandstone, the temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and features breathtaking sculptures of celestial dancers, musicians, and mythological figures. The introduction of iron beams in construction and the first use of surasundaris (heavenly maidens) on temple walls make it a significant milestone in temple architecture.

Surrounded by smaller shrines, Brahmeswar Temple's sanctum enshrines a powerful Shiva Lingam, drawing devotees and history lovers alike. The temple's rekha deul (curvilinear spire) and the exquisite nagara-style carvings tell stories of devotion, art, and cultural grandeur. Even after nearly a thousand years, it remains a serene and spiritual landmark in Bhubaneswar, the City of Temples.

It's a very beautiful temple dedicated to Lord Shiva and built in 1058 (around 1000 years old).
It's architecture is awesome. It's open for public and there is no ticket or entry fee.

places.generalDescription: Biju Patnaik Park, also known as the Forest Park, is a centrally located city park that offers expansive green spaces, well-maintained gardens, playgrounds, and trails. The park features unique attractions such as a floating mountain, jogging tracks, musical fountains, play areas for children, rockeries, and rosarium.

places.generalDescription: Ekamra Haat, located in Bhubaneswar, is a sprawling 5-acre marketplace that showcases the cultural diversity of Odisha through its handicrafts, handlooms, regional clothing, and delectable cuisine. This vibrant destination offers over 50 stalls where visitors can explore and purchase a wide array of handcrafted items. The lush green surroundings provide a picturesque backdrop for this celebration of art and crafts from various states of India.

sources.snippet: Pick this spot if you dare date your girl in public or if your relationship has been socially certified. sources.snippet: Set up by the Government of Odisha, Ekamra Haat is the perfect place to purchase handloom items as well as home decor products designed by the local artists of the city.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025

places.name: Ekamra Haat

reviews.text: Ekamra Haat is a great place to shop when in Bhubaneshwar. They have many stalls that sell a variety of Odishan handicrafts. You buy clothes and various wooden artefacts all at reasonable prices. They have kurtas, saris, traditional paintings. They also have a few food stalls and a cafe. Drinking water and toilets are also available here. They have ample of parking space. Great to buy souvenirs.

**Ekamra Haat, Bhubaneswar** is a vibrant cultural and craft hub that showcases Odisha's rich heritage. Located in the heart of the city, it serves as a one-stop destination for authentic handicrafts, handlooms, and regional delicacies.

### **Key Highlights**:
1. **Art and Craft**:
- The haat features an array of stalls offering traditional Odisha handicrafts such as Pattachitra paintings, stone carvings, terracotta, appliqu√© work, and silver filigree.
- Visitors can also explore handloom products like Sambalpuri sarees, Ikat fabrics, and tribal jewelry.

2. **Food Court**:
- The food court serves an assortment of Odia delicacies like Pakhala Bhata, Dalma, Chhena Poda, and more, giving visitors a taste of authentic regional cuisine.

3. **Cultural Programs**:
- Regular cultural performances, including Odissi dance and folk music, add a lively ambiance and celebrate Odisha's artistic heritage.

4. **Ambience**:
- The open-air setup, beautifully landscaped surroundings, and traditional architecture create a serene and welcoming environment.

5. **Affordability and Accessibility**:
- The products are reasonably priced, making it an excellent place for tourists and locals to purchase souvenirs.
- Its central location makes it easily accessible for everyone.

### **Visitor Experience**:
Ekamra Haat is highly rated for its cleanliness, friendly vendors, and authentic offerings. It's a must-visit for anyone interested in Odisha's art, culture, and cuisine.

**Recommendation**: Perfect for families, tourists, and culture enthusiasts looking to explore and experience Odisha's vibrant heritage.

Five Stars for Ekamra Haat!
If you're in Bhubaneswar and want a real taste of Odisha (and beyond!), Ekamra Haat is an absolute gem. I loved just strolling around, it has such a lovely, relaxed vibe. The way they've designed the stalls like little village huts gives it so much character.
I spent ages Browse the handicrafts ‚Äì the Pattachitra paintings are simply stunning, and I picked up some beautiful handloom fabric. It's so cool to see the artisans actually demonstrating their skills right there. You feel like you're getting a genuine piece of art, directly from the person who made it.
And the food! Oh my goodness, the food stalls are a must-try. I indulged in some delicious local Odia snacks that I still think about.
It's a fantastic spot for souvenirs, or just to soak in some local culture. Highly recommend a visit, whether you're a tourist or a local looking for something unique. Definitely brings a smile to your face!

places.address: 7RHR+73M, Unit 3, Madhusudan Marg, Ekamra Vihar, UNIT- 9, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751001, India

places.generalDescription: Utkal University, the first university in Odisha, is renowned for its academic excellence and cultural heritage. It is ranked among the top 100 universities nationally and offers a peaceful atmosphere amidst the bustling city of Bhubaneswar. The campus is vast and well-maintained, with tree-lined roads and informative signboards guiding visitors. Additionally, it provides convenient access to ATMs and banks within the premises.

sources.snippet: Take a leisurely stroll through the picturesque campus of Utkal University. With its beautiful gardens and serene surroundings, this university provides a lovely backdrop for couples. Enjoy the tranquility and maybe even find a cozy spot to sit and chat.

places.name: Utkal University

reviews.text:
One of the most premier govt University of Odisha , in the heart of the state capital , Vani vihar area of the temple city bhubaneswar.

All possible PG  / master degree courses available .

Utkal University is the first and largest university in Odisha. It was established in 1943 and is located in Vani Vihar, Bhubaneswar. The university offers courses in various subjects, including Arts, Science, Commerce, Law, Management, and Social Sciences.

The academic standards of the university are good, and the faculty members are experienced. Research and publications have improved significantly over the years. The university has a large library, which is helpful for students. There are also many clubs, cultural programs, and sports activities that play an important role in student life.

Although the university has decent infrastructure, some areas lack modern facilities. In some departments, the number of faculty members is low, which can sometimes create difficulties in academics. However, in terms of education quality, Utkal University is a good option for students.

Overall, it is one of the best universities in Odisha, offering good educational opportunities.

As everyone has atleast this knowledge that Utkal university is the first university of odisha: also it has that features that allow it stand so high between so many universities of odisha. It comes under top 100 university #88 in national level. The atmosphere is quiet and peaceful. You'll feel like as if you've come somewhere else not BHUBANESWAR. Bcz in Bhubaneswar finding a natural place like utkal is quite hard. I wish my dream of being a utkalian will come true soon with god's blessings. If you wanna know more Or have any question comment plz !!!  #utkal

A beautifully maintained park. Exclusively for those who don't mind paying a premium for fresh air.

Entry? Just 40 bucks. Want to park your bike? That's another 20. Got a car? That'll be 40. Because nature is best enjoyed with a price tag.

Truly a paradise ‚Ä¶ if your idea of a park includes a receipt.

One of the best parks in Bhubaneswar, this spacious park has recently undergone several upgrades, especially in the children's play area. It now features multiple slides and swings, making it a great spot for kids. A water fountain has also been added, which typically starts operating after 4:00 PM.

Another highlight is the newly inaugurated Cactus House, opened by the Hon'ble Chief Minister of Odisha, Shri Mohan Charan Majhi.

The park has an entry fee, which likely helps in maintaining a peaceful and less crowded environment. Inside the park, you'll also find a Koraput Coffee outlet that offers coffee, millet cookies, and millet cake at reasonable prices.

places.generalDescription: Bindu Sagar, also known as Bindu Sarovar, is a sacred lake located in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Surrounded by numerous temples and shrines, this sizable pond holds great religious and cultural significance in the area. Positioned near the renowned Lingaraja Temple and Ananta Vasudeva Temple, it is a popular destination for tourists and devotees alike.

sources.snippet: Bindu Sagar Lake, surrounded by ancient temples, becomes a canvas of colors during sunset. Couples can enjoy a serene boat ride, immersing themselves in the vibrant hues of the sky reflected on the water. It‚Äôs a moment to cherish as the day bids adieu in a romantic symphony.

places.name: Bindu Sagar

reviews.text: Bindu Sagar in Bhubaneswar is a tranquil and sacred lake steeped in spiritual significance. Surrounded by ancient temples, the lake is a hub of activity, with priests offering spiritual services and blessings to devotees near its banks. The serene environment and reflections of nearby temple spires on the water create a peaceful and picturesque setting. Visiting Bindu Sagar is a unique way to experience the blend of spirituality and natural beauty in Odisha's capital.

Nice place......Bindu Sagar Lake: A Sacred Waterbody in Bhubaneswar

Located near the iconic Lingaraj Temple in Bhubaneswar, Bindu Sagar Lake is a sacred waterbody of immense religious and cultural significance. Believed to contain drops of holy water from all the major rivers of India, this serene lake is surrounded by ancient temples and serves as a center for spiritual rituals and gatherings.

Experience the best sunsets and light show! üåá
üëçüèºBindusagar Lake is a picturesque and serene spot in Bhubaneswar, offering a peaceful retreat from the city's hustle. The lake, surrounded by lush greenery and historic temples, creates a beautiful and tranquil setting for visitors. The reflective waters and the scenic backdrop are perfect for leisurely walks, photography, or simply unwinding by the water.
üëéüèºHowever, the lake could benefit from improved cleanliness and better time management, especially during peak hours when it becomes crowded.

What really stood out, though, was the warm and familiar ambiance. It felt like stepping into a friend's home, with the staff being super friendly and welcoming.

Overall, I highly recommend this place for a quick, delicious, and satisfying meal. Can't wait to go back!

places.generalDescription: Rajarani Temple, located in Bhubaneswar, India, is an 11th-century Hindu temple known for its intricate stone sculptures. Often referred to as the 'love temple,' it features sensual carvings of women and couples on its exterior. The temple is named after the red and yellow sandstone, locally known as Rajarani, used in its construction. Despite its name, the temple does not house any deity or conduct pujas.

sources.snippet: Credits: Devasish Nandy, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons. Also known as the ‚ÄòLove Temple‚Äô, the Rajarani temple has sensual stone carvings of men, women and couples. Constructed between the 11th and 12th century BC, this ancient temple doesn‚Äôt belong to any specific sect of Hinduism.
sources.shortName: 47 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar 2024

sources.snippet: The Rajarani Temple was built sometime around the 11th or 12th century. It is one of the city‚Äôs most famous temples and takes its name after the red sand stone that the temple is constructed from. Built in the Pancharatha style of architecture, inside the temple you can see erotic carvings of couples and women.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Iconic Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

sources.snippet: Lastly, must visit places in Bhubaneswar include the Parasurameswara Temple, the Brahmeswara Temple, and the Mukteswara Temple. These ancient structures are a testament to the Kalinga style of architecture and are invaluable for anyone interested in India‚Äôs historical and religious landscape.

sources.snippet: Rajarani temple is one of the most eminent tourist sites in the city of Odisha. Since there are no idols inside the shrine, it is not affiliated with a particular Hindu sect but is instead widely labelled as Saivite. It is a must-visit place among all the tourist sites in the city.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025

places.name: Rajarani Temple

reviews.text: A true architectural gem! Rajarani Temple stands out with its intricate carvings and peaceful surroundings. Though it has no presiding deity, the temple's design and detailed stonework speak volumes about Odisha's rich heritage. The garden around the temple is beautifully maintained. A must-visit for history and art lovers in Bhubaneswar.

The Rajarani Temple in Bhubaneswar is a stunning example of ancient Odisha architecture and is often praised for its intricate carvings and serene ambiance. Built in the 11th century from beautiful reddish-gold sandstone locally known as "Rajarani," the temple stands out for its elegant sculptural detailing and unique architectural style that lacks a presiding deity, making it distinct among other temples in the city. Visitors often find the lush gardens surrounding the temple and the peaceful atmosphere ideal for a quiet stroll or photography. It's especially appreciated by history lovers and architecture enthusiasts who admire its rich heritage and artistic grandeur. Overall, the Rajarani Temple offers a memorable experience with a blend of cultural charm and tranquility.

Raja Rani Temple is a very beautiful temple. When you go here, you will come to know that this temple is very old. It is one of the oldest temples in Bhubaneswar. The garden here is very lovely. It will look very beautiful. It is also very well maintained. You will also get the facility of washroom here. People can go and sit here. You can also spend time with your family or you will have to pay a small entry fee to go here.

Caution - If you want to go here, then keep one thing in mind that you should go only after drinking water and the right time to go here is to go either in the early morning or in the evening, do not go in the afternoon. If it is summer time or winter time, you can go anytime. In summer, the sun will fall on your head and you may feel very hot. You may get heat stroke.

places.name: Ekamra Kanan

reviews.text:
Ekamra Kanan is an absolute gem for nature lovers and anyone who appreciates the beauty of flowers! This flower park is a peaceful escape in the heart of the city, offering stunning landscapes filled with vibrant blooms. The park is meticulously maintained, and the variety of flowers is breathtaking, making it an ideal spot for photography, leisurely strolls, or simply soaking in the natural beauty.

One of the highlights of Ekamra Kanan is the seasonal flower events that take place throughout the year. These events are a celebration of colors, showcasing a wide range of flowers in full bloom. Whether you're a flower enthusiast or just looking for a serene space to relax, this place has something for everyone. The park is also well-equipped with walking paths, benches, and shaded areas, making it easy to spend a few hours exploring.

The atmosphere here is incredibly calming, and the air is filled with the sweet fragrance of flowers-perfect for a day out with family, friends, or even for some solo reflection time. The staff is friendly, and the park is very clean, ensuring a pleasant visit. I highly recommend Ekamra Kanan to anyone looking for a peaceful and beautiful spot to unwind or enjoy the beauty of nature. It's truly a hidden treasure!

One of the biggest üèûÔ∏è park situated at the heart of the city. A very good place for family and friends. And has the koraput coffee as well. There is a rush early in the morning for morning walk and jogging. They have one issue with the tickets, everything is done in cash no online payment is accepted, so keep in mind . They have parking in the front which is also cash.
Such a beautiful this is. So green, clean. Perfect place for morning and evening walks. And yes for photoshoots. This place is amazing.

places.generalDescription: Pathani Samanta Planetarium in Bhubaneshwar is a modern government-run planetarium that offers astronomical shows to educate people about stars, planets, and galaxies. Established in 1990 by the Odisha Government's Science and Technology Department, it is named after the renowned Odia astronomer Pathani Samanta. The planetarium conducts shows on astronomy, astrophysics, and space science to raise awareness about the universe's physical concepts.

sources.snippet: Another interesting and informative place is the Planetarium where the couples can learn and enjoy science. They can not only learn but also enjoy the romantic night sky gazing where if they are lucky enough, they can spot the cosmos and name it after their love. Apart from the romance in sky gazing, they can also educate themselves about the poster shows and audiovisual programs.

Named after a famous astronomer, Pathani Samanta, the planetarium was established by the Science and Technology department of the Government of Odisha to create awareness and promote the subject. Enthusiasts often visit the planetarium for their informative audio visual programs, poster shows and for night sky gazing.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

sources.snippet: Pathani Samanta Planetarium offers an enchanting experience for couples fascinated by the cosmos. Attend a stargazing session, where the universe unfolds above you. Wrapped in the cosmic wonders, you can share dreams, aspirations, and whispers under the starlit sky, creating memories that are truly out of this world.
sources.shortName: BEST PLACES TO VISIT IN BHUBANESWAR FOR COUPLES | GUIDE | by ontravelx

sources.snippet: The Pathani Samanta Planetarium organises shows and workshops relating to astronomy regularly. This planetarium also exhibits different astronomy instruments, models of planets and stars, as well as instruments related to astrophysics.
sources.shortName: The 15 Most Iconic Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar

places.name: Pathani Samanta Planetarium

reviews.text: A very good space for children who are interested in space and planets. There are 4 show time, 2pm to 5pm for 30-40 minutes, in Odia, English & Hindi language. The film showing the vast natur eof the space, which also same time give a feelings that how tiny we are. The sun, galaxy, milky way and alpha century was described very clearly. The animated tour of the space was amazing and real like.  The parks around the planetorium was amazing. The sculptural display of Pathani Samanta's family was very beautiful and clear to understand. The writing was in English in Hindi. Having the gender based toilets for common use and sanitised. Bike parking is outside the main gate near the Acharyavihar MO-bus stoppage. One damaged/ punctured √ßar

It is situated near Acharya Vihar square. Here you can watch shows in three languages i.e.English,Hindi and Odia. The theme is mostly related to the Universe. Though they are charging money yet they are not paying attention for the renovation of the planetarium. The screening wall or display is working partially. Seats are not comfortable.Many seats are broken. The seating capacity is not for many people. So tickets are easily sold out

I did visit the place, but I saw a long queue for tickets. I didn't think I'd be able to get one, so I just explored the surroundings and returned.I haven't been inside, but I heard that the half of thr screens are broken, and the seats are damaged, which is an issue. However, the outside area is nice, and you can take a walk. For me, it's just an okay place.

places.address: Acharya Vihar - jaydev Vihar Rd, Doordarshan Colony, Gajapati Nagar, Bhubaneswar, Odisha 751015, India

places.generalDescription: Indira Gandhi Park in Bhubaneswar is a 10.60-acre park dedicated to the late Prime Minister of India, Indira Gandhi. It stands on the former parade ground where she delivered her final speech before her assassination. The park features well-maintained grass plots, trees, shrubbery, flower gardens, and fountains. Visitors can often find morning walkers, joggers, and residents taking leisurely strolls here.

sources.snippet: Boasting of a massive statue of Indira Gandhi installed in the heart of the park, Indira Gandhi Park is situated in Ashok Nagar area of suburb of Bhubaneswar. Spread over 10 acres of land area, the park is rich with vegetation, trees and flowering shrubs. The several sprinkling fountains installed in the heart of the park add to the beauty of it.
sources.shortName: 37 Places to visit in Bhubaneswar India 2025

sources.snippet: Indira Gandhi Park is definitely one of the most popular tourist sites in the city. The Park offers a number of other amenities that draw visitors, including canteens, musical fountains, waterfalls, and rose gardens, making it one of the most beautiful tourist sites in the city.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025

sources.snippet: If one goes by the name of the park, it should inspire patriotism. Ironically, it doesn‚Äôt. Located right in heart of the city, this park is an eternal favorite of the romantic couples and totally figures in the check-list of ambitious dating couples.
sources.shortName: 6 Outdoor Dating Ideas for Romantic Couples in the City

sources.snippet: It is one of the most favorite places amongst the romantic couples. It is famous as the landscape is full of lush-green pastures. The soothing breeze and the beautiful surroundings create romantic settings.
sources.shortName: Some Great Places to Visit in Bhubaneswar for Couples | by Amit Travel Blog

places.name: Indira Gandhi Park

reviews.text: In a bustling cityscape this Park is an Oasis of clean air and greenery. Wonderful layout and articulated architecture expands the area despite geographical limits. Open for better part of day people from all walks keep treading. Designated exercise and Yoga areas are clean. Maintenance staff are always at work. Garden is well lit and early morning goers are not hindered by darkness.

The park is a picturesque haven, featuring lush greenery, a captivating fountain, and a remarkable statue of our former PM Indira Gandhi at its center. With amenities like drinking water, ample seating, and a vast parking area, it caters to all age groups, providing a tranquil space to bask in nature's beauty.

Very nice park beautifully maintained and the waking track and grass lawns are nicely maintained best for morning walks and to spend your time involving fitness activities jogging open gim .. best place in center of city with good connectivity
